item.title: Tiger Global plans cautious venture future with a new $2.2B fund
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Tiger's last fund did well with investmetments in OpenAI, Waymo and Databricks. But it warns investors that AI valuations are already 'elevated.'

item.title: Environmental groups call for halt to new data center construction
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: More than 230 organizations signed a public letter urging members of Congress to take action.

item.title: Claude Code is coming to Slack, and that’s a bigger deal than it sounds
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Anthropic launches Claude Code in Slack, letting developers delegate coding tasks from chat threads. It's part of a shift toward AI-embedded collaboration that could reshape software workflows.

item.title: Google details security measures for Chrome’s agentic features
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Google details how it is enacting security guardrails before rolling out agentic capabilities on Chrome.

item.title: You can buy your Instacart groceries without leaving ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Shoppers will be able to go from recipe planning to checkout within the ChatGPT window.

item.title: TikTok adds a space for organizing content with others, teases ‘Shared Feeds’
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Shared Feeds will surface new content tailored to both users' tastes, such as sports or winter activities, and their favorite creators.

item.title: Petco’s security lapse affected customers’ SSNs, driver’s licenses, and more
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Petco said the exposure was due to an error in an application and that it is notifying victims whose data was affected.

item.title: Heat pump startup Quilt raises $20M Series B to expand sales
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Quilt has sold nearly 1,000 units in the U.S. and Canada, and the new funding should help expand sales operations to more states and provinces.

item.title: ‘ONE RULE’: Trump says he’ll sign an executive order blocking state AI laws despite bipartisan pushback
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: “I will be doing a ONE RULE Executive Order this week,” Trump posted on social media. “You can’t expect a company to get 50 Approvals every time they want to do something.”

item.title: Paramount goes to war with Netflix for Warner Bros. Discovery with hostile $108.4B bid
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Paramount Skydance on Monday launched a hostile, $108.4 billion bid to buy Warner Bros. Discovery, days after Warner Bros. agreed to be acquired by Netflix for $82.7 billion.

item.title: IBM to acquire Confluent for $11B as it seeks to bolster its data offerings
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: IBM is buying data infrastructure company Confluent for $11 billion in cash in a bid to bolster its data and automation products as ever more companies move their tech operations to the cloud and deploy AI technology.

item.title: Adobe launches content creation hub in Premiere mobile for YouTube Shorts creators
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The company says the space is designed to give creators everything they need to produce viral videos, grow their audience, and tap into trends, whether it's creating day-in-the-life vlogs, travel videos, or behind-the-scenes clips.

item.title: Hinge’s new AI feature helps daters move beyond boring small talk
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Hinge launched “Convo Starters,” a feature powered by AI that provides personalized tips for initiating meaningful conversations.

item.title: OpenAI boasts enterprise win days after internal ‘code red’ on Google threat
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: ChatGPT Enterprise usage grew 8x year-over-year as workers report saving an hour daily, but OpenAI faces competitive pressure from Anthropic and questions about cost sustainability.

item.title: Netflix co-CEO discussed Warner Bros. deal with Trump
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Trump reportedly told Sarandos that Warner Bros. should sell to the highest bidder, and the Netflix executive seems to have left the meeting convinced that the president would not immediately oppose the acquisition.

item.title: X deactivates European Commission’s ad account after the company was fined €120M
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: X has seemingly penalized the European Commission's account after the commission fined the company over blue checkmarks and ad transparency.

item.title: The accelerator is on the floor for autonomous vehicles
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

item.title: Coinbase starts onboarding users again in India, plans for fiat on-ramp next year
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Coinbase is exploring expansion into India with a staggered relaunch and hiring for different roles.

item.title: OpenAI says it’s turned off app suggestions that look like ads
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: While OpenAI continues to insist that there are currently no ads — or tests for advertising — live in ChatGPT, the company’s chief research officer also acknowledged that the company “fell short” with recent promotional messages.

item.title: Pat Gelsinger wants to save Moore’s Law, with a little help from the Feds
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The company is aiming to produce its first silicon wafers by 2028 and have its first commercial system online by 2029.
